intro: Muscles work in pairs. When one contracts (shortens), the other relaxes (elongates).

BICEPS.title: Biceps (The Flexor)
BICEPS.desc: Found at the front of the upper arm. It contracts to bend the arm at the elbow joint.
BICEPS.tip: In PLE diagrams, if the biceps is short and thick, the arm is flexing!

TRICEPS.title: Triceps (The Extensor)
TRICEPS.desc: Found at the back of the arm. It contracts to straighten (extend) the arm.
TRICEPS.tip: Biceps and Triceps are opposites. They never contract at the same time.

concepts: Muscles only PULL; they cannot push.
Good nutrition (Protein) is needed for muscle repair.
